body:
Apologies if this is a duplicate issue. I tried to find an existing one, and couldn't.


related

- https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/3553
- https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/2390
- https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/2626

Hi @findepi,

Congratulations on submitting your first issue for JUnit! üëç 

I confirmed the behavior you have reported, and it sounds like it might well be a bug.

In addition, I see you edited your comment and added links to related issues, and I agree that this is likely related to #3553.
Note, however, that `b.TestChild.testPackagePrivateNameCollision()` actually runs as expected **if** you select only that method to run -- for example, via the `Launcher` API or within an IDE.
Perhaps either `ReflectionUtils.isMethodOverriddenBy(...)` or `ReflectionUtils.isPackagePrivate(...)` doesn't work as expected.

issue.title: Verify JUnit no tests shadowing

repository.name: trino
repository.description: Official repository of Trino, the distributed SQL query engine for big data, formerly known as PrestoSQL (https://trino.io)

issue.body:
Workaround for JUnit issue

- https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/5098

tests that could be silently skipped by JUnit, are detected and test run is aborted.


## Summary by Sourcery

Add a custom TestExecutionListener that scans the test plan for non-public test methods overriding superclass methods and fails early to avoid silent test skipping, and register it with JUnit‚Äôs service loader.

New Features:
- Introduce ReportOverriddenMethods listener to detect non-public JUnit test methods that shadow overridden methods and prevent silent skips

Enhancements:
- Register the new listener via META-INF/services for automatic discovery by JUnit

body: It could also be that we find both methods but compute the same unique ID for them so one of them gets discarded. I'll investigate.

The root cause is that `ClassSelectorResolver` returns two `MethodSelector` instances that are considered equal because `className` (`"b.TestChild"`), `methodName` (`"testPackagePrivateNameCollision"`), and `parameterTypeNames` (`""`) are equal.

issue.title: Fix support for package-private test methods

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ‚úÖ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Prior to this commit, when the test super class wss declared in another
package and declared a package-private test method with the same
signature as the subclass, the method from the subclass was silently
ignored. With the changes in this commit, both test methods are
executed, albeit with the same display name.

Fixes #5098.

- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)

body: I submitted #5100 to address this. Judging by the code, this is not a regression and hasn't ever worked. Therefore, if we feel the changes in #5100 are too risky, we should consider moving this to 6.1.0 rather than 6.0.1.

issue.title: Test method is silently skipped when parent class has same-named package-private test method (backport)
